e4: Switching to the new unbiased reporting policy aligns with ethical standards and legal compliance, thereby mitigating potential future legal risks or regulatory scrutiny. Although it might initially confuse some investors, over time, it will build greater trust and credibility, and it is likely that the market will adapt to the true financial disclosure, leading to a more accurate valuation of the company's shares.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should ensure accuracy, transparency, and honesty in disclosing financial performance, aligning closely with legal standards and fair business practices. It should aim to provide all investors, regardless of their sophistication level, with clear and dependable information to base their decisions on, minimizing any potential for manipulation or misinterpretation. Moreover, it should consider the impact on all stakeholders, ensuring that changes in reporting are communicated effectively and transparently to avoid any misunderstanding or disadvantage.
e6: How will the transition to the new reporting policy be communicated to ensure that all investors, especially less sophisticated ones, understand the change? What measures will be taken to prevent any potential negative market reactions during the initial phase of implementing the new policy? Are there contingency plans to manage any unforeseen impacts stemming from this policy shift?
